member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.VisibilityMode
member.summary: Describes the conditions under which a particular external command will be visible in the Revit UI.
member.remarks:
Note that there are a few conditions where the Revit API framework prevents commands from being available always:
When the user has another Revit command active, e.g. creating Windows, Doors, or editing sketches.
When the active view is in perspective mode, or when the view is a Walkthrough, Drawings Lists, View Lists, Note Blocks, View Lists, etc.
When the user is editing an in-place family.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.VisibilityMode.AlwaysVisible
member.summary: The command is available in all possible modes supported by the Revit API.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.VisibilityMode.NotVisibleInProject
member.summary: The command is invisible when there is a project document active.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.VisibilityMode.NotVisibleInFamily
member.summary: The command is invisible when there is a family document active.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.VisibilityMode.NotVisibleWhenNoActiveDocument
member.summary: The command is invisible when there is no active document.

member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.Discipline
member.summary: Describes the conditions under which a particular external command will be visible in the Revit UI.
member.remarks:
Note that there are a few conditions where the Revit API framework prevents commands from being available always:
When the user has another Revit command active, e.g. creating Windows, Doors, or editing sketches.
When the active view is in perspective mode, or when the view is a Walkthrough, Drawings Lists, View Lists, Note Blocks, View Lists, etc.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.Discipline.Any
member.summary: The command is available in all possible disciplines.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.Discipline.Architecture
member.summary: The command is available in the Architecture discipline.

member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType
member.summary: Defines types of warnings issued by Revit related to Add-In failures.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoWarning
member.summary: There is no warning in this AddIn.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.ClassNotFound
member.summary: Revit could not find the indicated class in the assembly file.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.WrongAssemblyPath
member.summary: Revit could not find the assembly file.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.UncaughtException
member.summary: Unhandled exceptions were caught when the AddIn was executed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.GUIDConflict
member.summary: There is another add-in which registered the same Id (GUID).

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoFullClassName
member.summary: Missing the required value of the FullClassName node.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoClientId
member.summary: Missing the required value of the ClientId node.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoAssembly
member.summary: Missing the required value of the Assembly node.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoApplicationName
member.summary: Missing the required value of the Name node for application add-in.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.InvalidFormatClientId
member.summary: Revit could not interop.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.WrongAvailabilityClass
member.summary: Revit could not invoke IExternalCommandAvailability correctly.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.UncaughtExceptionInAvailabilityClass
member.summary: Unhandled exceptions were caught when the availability command was executed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.InvalidTransactionAttributeError
member.summary: Not a valid transaction attribute.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.InvalidRegenerationAttributeError
member.summary: Not a valid regeneration attribute.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.WarningType.NoVendorId
member.summary: Missing the required value of the VendorId node.

member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInManifestUtility
member.summary: This static class provides access to read the contents of manifests from Revit .addin files.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInManifestUtility.GetRevitAddInManifest(System.String)
member.summary: Reads an AddInManifest from the input .addin file.
member.param: The full path to a .addin file.
member.returns: The AddInManifest read from the file.
member.exception: Thrown when file name is incorrect (it is not a .addin file), or when the .addin file has an unrecognized format.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInManifestUtility.GetRevitAddInManifests(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Reads all AddInManifests from the .addin files available in a folder.
member.param: The folder that contains some .addin files.
The dictionary is to hold invalid format manifest information, and these invalid information can be handled later. If it is , those exceptions will be ignored simply.
member.returns: The collection of AddInManifests read from the file(s).
member.exception: Thrown when the input argument is .

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInManifestUtility.GetRevitAddInBundleManifests(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Reads all AddInManifests in bundle folders which are matched with revit version and os.
member.param: Revit version.
OS type, Win32 or Win64.
The dictionary is to hold invalid format manifest information, and these invalid information can be handled later. If it is , those exceptions will be ignored simply.
member.exception: Thrown when the input argument is .

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInManifestUtility.createRevitAddInManifest(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an AddInManifest with the input file name.
member.param: The full path to a .addin file.
member.returns: The AddInManifest read from the file.
member.exception: Thrown when file name is incorrect (it is not a .addin file), or when the .addin file has an unrecognized format.
member.remarks: This method will only create a new instance of RevitAddInManifest file with the input file name. It would not load the content of the manifest file. To create a RevitAddInManifest file and load the content, please call

member.summary: The text displayed on the external command button.

member.summary: The short description and short tooltip for the command.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInCommand.LargeImage
member.summary: The path to the large image for the command button.
member.remarks: This image will be shown on the button in the External Tools pulldown. The image should be 32 x 32 pixels. If the image is larger it will be adjusted to fit the button.

member.summary: The text shown in the extended command tooltip.

member.summary: The image shown in the extended command tooltip.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInCommand.VisibilityMode
member.summary: The modes in which the external command will be visible.
member.remarks:
There are 2 sets of modes where visibility can be set:
Visibility affected by the type of active document.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInCommand.Discipline
member.summary: The modes in which the external command will be visible.
member.remarks:
There is 1 set of mode where visibility can be set:
Visibility affected by the availability of a certain discipline.

member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem
member.summary: Represents a single Revit Add-In.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.Assembly
member.summary: The file path for the assembly which defines the Add-In.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.AddInId
member.summary: The id for the Add-In. Each add-in must be assigned a unique identifier.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.FullClassName
member.summary: The full class name for the class providing the entry point into the Add-In.
member.remarks: This is the class implementing IExternalCommand or IExternalApplication.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.VendorId
member.summary: The vendor id.
member.remarks: This is required by add-in application.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.VendorDescription
member.summary: The vendor description.
member.remarks: This should be a string that the user can use to identify the vendor.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.SuppressedWarning
member.summary: A startup failure which, if it occurs, will be suppressed from the user.
member.remarks: When Revit attempts to start an Add-In and fails to do so, it will show a message to the user about the error. Users have the option to ignore that error in the future. This property is used to represent the user's choice to ignore an error. Note that if a different error occurs for the Add-In, it will still be shown to the user.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.ProductImage
member.summary: The product image.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.ProductDescription
member.summary: The product description.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.AllowLoadingIntoExistingSession
member.summary: The flag of loading permission.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.ProductVersion
member.summary: The product version.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.LoadCancelledByUser
member.summary: Indicates if load add in is cancelled by user or not.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInItem.SigningStatus
member.summary: Code signing status of the add in.

member.remarks: NULL returns until set with the absolute file path in AddInManagerUtils::loadAddins().

member.summary: Represents the contents of a single .addin file.
member.remarks: The manifest contains a collection of external commands and external applications listed in the .addin file.

member.summary: Constructs a new empty manifest.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.Name
member.summary: The file name which is associated with the manifest.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.FullName
member.summary: The full path and file name which is associated with the manifest.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.AddInApplications
member.summary: The collection of all external applications in the manifest.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.AddInDBApplications
member.summary: The collection of all external DB applications in the manifest.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.AddInCommands
member.summary: The collection of all external commands in the manifest.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.Save
member.summary: Saves the information in the manifest to its associated .addin file location.
member.exception: Thrown when FullName is or empty.
Thrown when FullName is incorrect (it is not a .addin file). Or there are no external commands or applications to write to manifest file.
The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the information in the manifest as a new .addin file..
member.param: The full path and file name which is associated with the manifest.
member.exception: Thrown when file name argument is or empty.
Thrown when file name is incorrect (it is not a .addin file). Or there are no external commands or applications to write to manifest file.
The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: input an addin file

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitAddInManifest.Load
member.summary: Reloads AddInManifest from addin file.
member.exception: Filename is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains invalid characters.
There is a load or parse error in the XML.

member.summary: Represents an installed instance of Revit on the local machine.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.AllUsersAddInFolder
member.summary: The folder path in which .addin files associated to all users will be located for this product.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.CurrentUserAddInFolder
member.summary: The folder path in which .addin files associated to the current user will be located for this product.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.InstallLocation
member.summary: The folder path where this Revit product is installed.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.Name
member.summary: User-visible name for this Revit product. such as : 'Autodesk Revit Architecture 2010'.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.Architecture
member.summary: The system architecture of this Revit product installation.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.ProductCode
member.summary: The id used to locate and identify the Revit product from the registry.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.Version
member.summary: The version for this Revit product. Such as: '2010'.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.Subversion
member.summary: The release subversion.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.Product
member.summary: The product type.

member.name: P:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.ReleaseSubVersion
member.summary: The string for the release sub versions.
member.remarks: SubVersion releases may have additional APIs and functionality not available in the standard customer releases. Add-ins written to support standard Revit releases should be compatible with Subversion releases, but add-ins written specifically targeting new features in Subversion releases would not be compatible with the standard releases.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.GetInstalledLanguages
member.summary: Gets the installed language types.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.#ctor(System.Guid,Autodesk.RevitAddIns.ProductType,Autodesk.RevitAddIns.AddInArchitecture,Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitVersion)
member.summary: Constructor, set basic info for an Revit product.
member.param: Use to uniquely identify each product, it's a GUID.
Use to identify product type.
Architecture information, such as 32bit or 64bit.
Define the version number, such as 2010, 2011.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProduct.getSubscriptionValue
member.summary: Gets the SubscriptionUpdate value from the registry.

member.name: T:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility
member.summary: Provides access to installed versions of Revit on the local machine.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.GetAllInstalledRevitProducts
member.summary: Gets a list of Revit products installed on this machine.
member.remarks: This operation parses the registry for necessary information about the installation(s). An incomplete or incorrect installation of Revit may not be returned correctly by this utility.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.initializeProductsDictionary
member.summary:
Initialize a dictionary to store all the RevitProducts which can be supported by this RevitAddInUtility
NOTE: This method only initializes the product codes for Revit 2011 and RVT 2013. Since 2012 we analysis the Revit product code (not include the dynamo) of RevitDB.dll component with a fixed pattern, please see RevitProductUtility::getRevitProduct method for more details.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.getInstalledProductInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets information of installed Revit from registry.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.getInstalledRevitProductCodes
member.summary: Gets product codes of the installed Revits.

member.name: M:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.getRevitProduct(System.String)
member.summary: Gets product information with the product code.

member.name: F:Autodesk.RevitAddIns.RevitProductUtility.m_productsHashtable
member.summary: Is used to store all the RevitProduct which can be supported by this RevitAddInUtility.
